I was doing GUI testing using JFCUnit (extension of JUnit), which provides a
set of libraries for accessing JFC/Swing component.  It was working fine.
But the developers are switching towards Eclipse (rewritting the entire
application using eclipse(SWT components + JFace  ) ) to gain more
performance.
 
(link to eclipse ...)
http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/os-ecgui1/
<http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/os-ecgui1/> 
 
The JFCUnit can identify only swing component like (JFrame, JButton,
JMenuBar etc ..).   
(link to JFCUnit ...)
http://jfcunit.sourceforge.net <http://jfcunit.sourceforge.net> 
 
They cannot identify the SWT components.  So I can't use JFCUnit hereafter.
 
(link to SWT component ...)
http://www.swtworkbench.com/about_swt.shtml
<http://www.swtworkbench.com/about_swt.shtml> 
 
Is there any framework for testing SWT component.  (by testing I mean black
box testing - regression, not white box testing).
 
 
 

-----Original Message-----
From: Shane Duan [mailto:sduan@...]
Sent: Friday, March 21, 2003 12:47 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] automation tool for GUI testing ...


What do you mean JUnit doesn't support eclipse (assuming you are talking 
about the open source IDE project)?

And I believe eclipse support JUnit.

Pradeep Bojan wrote:

>Is there any tool for automating GUI, designed by eclipse.  I basically
need
>it for doing regression testing.   Junit doesn't support eclipse.  Please
>let me know.
> 
>Regards,
> 
>Pradeep.
>  
>
